FacilityName: City of Rayne Water Treatment Plant

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
The accidental release prevention policy at this facility is proper employee training and tank handling procedures during transfer, connection and disconnection of cholorine stroage tanks; also training in proper maintenance of storage and process equipment. The emergency response policy at the facility is to immediately notify the Acadia Parish Office of Emergency Preparedness through 911.



The stationary source consist of two(2) one (1) ton cylinders of chlorine.



The worst case release scenario would consist of a rupture of the one ton cylinder allowing all of the cholirine inside to be relesed in ten minutes, which would create a cloud of chlorine with a radius of 1.3 miles and an affected population of 8,7000 people.  There are no passive mitigation measures in place to affect the severety of the release.



The alternative release scenario consist of a fusible plug blowing out of the chlorine cylinder.  It will take approximately an hour for offsite responders to respond to the release.  It will have a release rate of 2 lbs/min and will have a radius of effect of 0.1 miles and effect 90 people.  There is no active or passive mitigation in place at the facility.



Proper training of operators and maintenance personnel prevents accidental release and chemical specific hazards.



There has been two accidentents at the facility in the past eight (10) years.  One accident took place on November 10, 1977 at approximately 2;00 pm in the afternoon.  The event involved improper opening of a valve on the one ton cylinder and resulted in a very short release (<10 sec) before the leak was stopped.  The worker went to a doctor after his shift was over. The other accident took place on February 17,2007 at approx. 8am. The event involved improper opening of a valve on the one ton cylinder also, and resulted in a short release (<15 sec) before leak was stopped. Worker went to emergency room and released same day.



The emergency response at this facility is handled by

offsite personnel (fire department, police, etc.).  The Acadia Parish Office of Emergency Preparedness will be responsible for notification of the public and evacuation/sheltering in place of people within the radius of effect.  Asco Environmental Service will be responsible for repairing any leak to a chlorine tank that caused an accidental release.



Some changes that have been planned to improve safety are labeling all process equipment that contains chlorine.
